text.p: Commerzbank AG said on Tuesday it was keeping a "buy" recommendation on Dresdner Bank AG after the bank announced a 23 percent rise in first-half operating profit and plans for a capital increase.

The bank said in a statement that the announcement last week of plans by Bayerische Vereinsbank AG and Bayerische Hypotheken und Wechsel-Bank AG to merge would continue to encourage merger speculation and ensure Dresdner's shares continue to rise.
Commerzbank said it was unclear what Dresdner planned to achieve with its planned 120 million mark-nominal capital increase.
While the bank might be seeking a foreign acquisition, a domestic acquisition was unlikely after Dresdner failed to secure a co-operation with Hypo-Bank.
Dresdner itself said on Tuesday it did not plan to buy in Germany.
"The bank wants to use the favourable market conditions to make use of its leeway to act," analyst Dieter Hein wrote.
"An acquisition in the insurance sector appears unlikely," Hein added.
Hein expects Dresdner to report earnings per share of 3.15 marks this year and 3.50 marks in 1998.
